definition: cormorant
cormorant
variant of 鶿|鹚[ci2]
cormorant
(bird species of China) great cormorant (Phalacrocorax carbo)
(bird species of China) Japanese cormorant (Phalacrocorax capillatus)
(bird species of China) pelagic cormorant (Phalacrocorax pelagicus)
(bird species of China) red-faced cormorant (Phalacrocorax urile)
(bird species of China) little cormorant (Phalacrocorax niger)

sentences.english: As soon as the baby cormorant breaks the eggs, it is watched by Damin himself.
sentences.chinese: 小鸬鹚一啄破蛋壳，大明就亲自照看它。

sentences.english: The fisherman tightens the birds' collars to keep them from swallowing their catches.
sentences.chinese: 渔夫收紧鸬鹚的脖套，防止它们吞下捕捉到的猎物。

sentences.english: A cormorant can catch 15kg of fish a day, but only after three to five years of training.
sentences.chinese: 一只受训三到五年的鸬鹚一天可捉到15公斤鱼。

sentences.english: In 50 years, perhaps there will be no more cormorant fishermen in the world.
sentences.chinese: 年以后，或许世界上将不再有鸬鹚渔民了。

sentences.english: And in summer. One of its features is countless constantly screaming seagulls and independently looking at them proud black cormorants.
sentences.chinese: 而到了夏天，尖叫的海鸥和黑色的鸬鹚，随处可见。

sentences.english: In 50 years, perhaps there will be no more cormorant fishermen in the world.
sentences.chinese: 在50年后，也许世界上再没有用鸬鹚捕鱼的渔夫了。

sentences.english: As soon as the baby cormorant breaks the eggs, it is watched by Damin himself.
sentences.chinese: 小鸬鹚一啄破蛋壳，年夜明就亲身照看它。
那些鸟是受过训练的鸬鹚。

sentences.english: Damin usually sets off in the late afternoon and gets the cormorants ready for work.
sentences.chinese: 达明通常在傍晚出发，让鸬鹚准备好工作。

sentences.english: Damin usually sets off in the late afternoon and gets the cormorants ready for work.
sentences.chinese: 大民通常在傍晚动身并让鸬鹚准备好工作。

sentences.english: Damin usually sets off in the later afternoon and gets the cormorants ready for work.
sentences.chinese: 大民经常在下午后段出发并使鸬鹚们都准备好工作。

waterbird

(bird species of China) mallard (Anas platyrhynchos)

(bird species of China) eastern spot-billed duck (Anas zonorhyncha)
(bird species of China) European herring gull (Larus argentatus)
seabird
